author: bbockelm
body: CMSSW and Xrootd both implement a retry mechanism, one on top of the other.  We are getting reports from the IBs that Xrootd's retry mechanism is possibly causing the file-close callbacks to be invoked twice (and the second time it is done against a deleted object, causing a `SIGSEGV`).  This work attempts to see if the problem can be avoided by relying solely on CMSSW's recovery mechanisms.
title: Disable Xrootd's read recovery mechanism.
